snippet: Leslie H. Gelb and Frank G. Wisner said they were bothered by the claims of former directors and their supporters that interrogation methods had all been authorized, effective and disclosed.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

lead_paragraph: Leslie H. Gelb and Frank G. Wisner said they were bothered by the claims of former directors and their supporters that interrogation methods had all been authorized, effective and disclosed.

headline.main: Two Outlooks on Criticism of the C.I.A.
headline.print_headline: 2 Outlooks on Criticism of the C.I.A.
